verses.text: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim-zophim , of mount Ephraim , and his name \add was\add* Elkanah , the son of Jeroham , the son of Elihu , the son of Tohu , the son of Zuph , an Ephrathite :
And he had two wives ; the name of the one \add was\add* Hannah , and the name of the other Peninnah : and Peninnah had children , but Hannah had no children.

And this man went up out of his city yearly to worship and to sacrifice unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts in Shiloh. And the two sons of Eli , Hophni and Phinehas , the priests of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, \add were\add* there.  +  r 1.3  t yearly: Heb. from year to year * \p
¶ And when the time was that Elkanah offered , he gave to Peninnah his wife , and to all her sons and her daughters , portions :
But unto Hannah he gave a worthy portion ; for he loved Hannah : but the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had shut up her womb.\f + \fr 1.5 \ft worthy: or, double\f*
And her adversary also provoked her sore , for to make her fret , because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had shut up her womb.\f + \fr 1.6 \ft provoked: Heb. angered\f*

And \add as\add* he did so year by year , when she went up to the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, so she provoked her; therefore she wept , and did not eat.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft when…: or, from the time that she, etc: Heb. from her going up\f*
Then said Elkanah her husband to her, Hannah , why weepest thou? and why eatest thou not? and why is thy heart grieved ? \add am\add* not I better to thee than ten sons ? \p
¶ So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh , and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest sat upon a seat by a post of the temple of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And she \add was\add* in bitterness of soul , and prayed unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and wept sore.\f + \fr 1.10 \ft in…: Heb. bitter of soul\f*

And she vowed a vow , and said , O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts , if thou wilt indeed look on the affliction of thine handmaid , and remember me, and not forget thine handmaid , but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man child , then I will give him unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* all the days of his life , and there shall no razor come upon his head.  +  r 1.11  t a man…: Heb. seed of men *
And it came to pass, as she continued praying before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that Eli marked her mouth.\f + \fr 1.12 \ft continued…: Heb. multiplied to pray\f*
Now Hannah , she spake in her heart ; only her lips moved , but her voice was not heard : therefore Eli thought she had been drunken.
And Eli said unto her, How long wilt thou be drunken ? put away thy wine from thee.

And Hannah answered and said , No, my lord , I \add am\add* a woman of a sorrowful spirit : I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink , but have poured out my soul before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft of a sorrowful…: Heb. hard of spirit\f*
Count not thine handmaid for a daughter of Belial : for out of the abundance of my complaint and grief have I spoken hitherto.\f + \fr 1.16 \ft complaint: or, meditation\f*
Then Eli answered and said , Go in peace : and the God of Israel grant \add thee\add* thy petition that thou hast asked of him.
And she said , Let thine handmaid find grace in thy sight. So the woman went her way , and did eat , and her countenance was no more \add sad\add*. \p

¶ And they rose up in the morning early , and worshipped before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and returned , and came to their house to Ramah : and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife ; and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* remembered her.

Wherefore it came to pass, when the time was come about after Hannah had conceived , that she bare a son , and called his name Samuel , \add saying\add*, Because I have asked him of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 1.20 \ft when…: Heb. in revolution of days\f*\f + \fr 1.20 \ft Samuel: that is, Asked of God\f*
And the man Elkanah , and all his house , went up to offer unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* the yearly sacrifice , and his vow.

But Hannah went not up ; for she said unto her husband , \add I will not go up\add* until the child be weaned , and \add then\add* I will bring him, that he may appear before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and there abide for ever.

And Elkanah her husband said unto her, Do what seemeth thee good ; tarry until thou have weaned him; only the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* establish his word. So the woman abode , and gave her son suck until she weaned him. \p

¶ And when she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bullocks , and one ephah of flour , and a bottle of wine , and brought him unto the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in Shiloh : and the child \add was\add* young.
And they slew a bullock , and brought the child to Eli.
And she said , Oh my lord , \add as\add* thy soul liveth , my lord , I \add am\add* the woman that stood by thee here, praying unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
For this child I prayed ; and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath given me my petition which I asked of him:

Therefore also I have lent him to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; as long as he liveth he shall be lent to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. And he worshipped the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* there.  +  r 1.28  t lent him: or, returned him, whom I have obtained by petition *  +  r 1.28  t he shall…: or, he whom I have obtained by petition shall be returned *
